rComments: Worst teacher I've ever had. Spends all her time bragging about how many useless degrees she has, putting down students, and rambling.

Without giving clear and concise instructions on any assignment, Fran expects you to be some sociological prodigy. The course topics are entirely centered around HER and her centers of interest rather than important sociological studies. Her tangents revolve around herself and most of the time, its irrelevant AT BEST. Avoid taking her at all costs.

We talked about things relevant to the course for maybe 20 minutes each lecture. The rest of it is Fran yelling about lazy students. She expects everyone to ace papers but doesn't give clear instructions and is surprised when people don't do well. She went over assignments either out of order or the day before they are due, which was very stressful

Fran is the by far the best Professor at UCSC.  She explains all concepts, she genuinely cares about her students, and makes time for them. Her knowledge base is wide, I say this because she is to be modeled by other professors at UCSC . Fran sets you up for success. come to class, do the homework and be engaged. 2 exams 1 project. 1 book

Fran is an extremely caring yet eccentric teacher. A lot of students misunderstand her, but what it comes down to it really matters to her if students are getting a good education. She is one of the better teachers that I have had, although I do feel that she is easier to learn from in smaller elective classes because there is more direct feedback.

100 points total. 2 midterms (30 each) and 1 final project (20). Go to section, worth 20 points. If you show up to lecture (which can be a bore as she goes on tangents)  and use her study guides you will get an A. Trust when she says whatever is on the study guide, is on the test.

WORST PROFESSOR. EVER. TOO MANY TANGENTS. EVERY LECTURE. do not expect anything more. She is LITerally :(  You have said time and time again I am not bragging, but I am always educating myself. I have done blah blah blah I have an interest in continuing to teach myself etc COOL FRAN. COOL. Thats you. BUT WHAT DOES THAT HAVE TO DO WITH 103B?

Fran is passionate about telling the class stories about her own life and about how past students have pissed her off. She will discuss assignment 3 the day before assignment 1 is due- not helpful. Instructions for papers are incredibly unclear and when you ask for help she berates students for not inherently knowing what to do.

Was an interesting class, there was one midterm and a final paper. Fran tends to go off top in lecture but it is entertaining. You should read for the midterm. Wants to help if you just go talk to her. Takes attendance when she feels like it, she doesn't always feel like it.

Fran is amazing! She is so informational and resourceful. You have to do the readings because it's required to cite heavily in essays. Thier usually short and interesting. There are no midterms or exams so the essays are weighed heavily, but she allows opportunities to redo them for a better grade. This s not a class to bs your essay's!

Fran was amazingly supportive of my education and did everything she could to make sure everyone did well in the class, and higher education overall. She was an excellent teacher, and fun to listen to. Class was also very easy, I skipped a majority of lectures and still aced the final exam.

Fran is a great teacher, subjects can be boring at times since its an intro class but her grading is simple and if you show up and study a few days before the tests its an easy A. easy class, would recommend  don't even necessarily need to go to class all the time

Fran is a goddess. She is a dream. She definitely goes on tangent and probably believes herself to be better than every student in the room, and you know? She's right. She takes so much time and effort to make sure she is being politically correct and respectful of everyone. The world would be a better place if we could clone her 1000 times over.

She's a good teacher and she gives you study guides for both midterms. Aslong as you do them & study you should pass. Go to discussions, it's worth 20 easy points. I don't like the way she does notes they're a bit confusing & she rambles on ocassionally.  I'd recommend the class though

She spends too much class time going off on tangents. She doesn't use PowerPoint and her lectures are on a typed paper that she scribbles on. That class is passable but going to class felt like torture. Definitely would not recommend this class

I was very satisfied in taking this class. She was really funny and her lectures are interesting. Sections are mandatory but they are an easy 20 points for your grade. the readings for the class were long, but they were interesting. I would definitely take another class with her.  I am definitely going to miss having this class.

It was an overall interesting class that requires a lot of reading. Don't stress it too much because she gives you a study guide for both exams and section is mandatory (it counts towards your grade). She made lecture enjoyable because she isn't a boring professor and was very passionate about the topics discussed.
Fran is very passionate about teaching and she really cares about her students. I recommend her!!
Most pretentious professor I have ever had. Spends half the class bragging and the rest telling how smart she is and how stupid you are.

She once told a student to shut up for correcting her wrong math in class...The worst and most frustrating professor I have ever had at UCSC. Don't go to class unless you have a test or wanna hear her rant about how smart she is and how stupid you are. You can pass just reading the book and using the study guides. I only went to 8 classes & passed

Fran spouts off ignorant conspiracy theories, and often is off or extremely biased in her information. She exudes a highly moral attitude and tries to be pretentious. Be prepared to hear 3 or 4 personal anecdotes per lecture -- often repeated throughout the quarter. She seems like a nice person, but seems really insecure.

SOC1 is a combination between a sociology class and a class about Fran's life- the sociology part is really, really interesting, but the part about Fran's life gets really redundant after the 5th time.  Fran is very knowledgeable, but a little unorganized. Take this class if you're interested (I recommend it), but don't take too many of her classes

Lectures where very entertaining. Loved this class, but I wouldn't take it if you're a conservative because she's very opinionated. The midterms were all on what was went over the lecture before. She's not as tough as she seems, and she can be pretty understanding if go to her office hours.

Fran? more like FIEND! it was entertaining listenin 2 her talkin bout her sucky life n her neva satisfying mountain of edu credentials (like she's trying to take over the world). She have HIGH expectation of her students to meet her HARVARD standard.it takes rocket science to understand wut fran is make of?! if the neva attaining A is ur challenge!

I liked Fran the first time I took a class with her. I thought she was funny, sarcastic, and honest. Now I'm just sick of her lectures. It was ok to hear about the adversity she overcame to be a successful scholar the first five times, but now its just getting ridiculous. i will not take another class with her
Do not take fran for research methods becuz she would b sure to make your quarter a living helll! AVOID @ ALL COST!

Her lectures are mandatory, but she dun regularily take attendence. But one of those days you dont show up, it'll hurt you badd! And she gets ticked-off when you didn't cite correctly; for instance like a missing space! Be Warned!!!

Surviving fran's class is all based on how well you face distraction; from her talkin about her crappy life and all the useless handouts she passes out in class that have nothing to do her lecture. This woman is extreme/crazy, she forces her point of view onto her students!

THIs is the first time I put so much effort to earn a "F" while i spent sleepless night to write essays on her SUPER CONFUSING PROMPTS...thinking about it makes me want to cry because I've learned nothing valuable T_T..I think i would've benefited more if she bother to hire a teaching assistant because meeting her one on one is very intimidating...
Fran is the most despicable teacher when it comes to grading.. do not take her class when grammar is your problem because she wouldnt tolerate minor mistakes!

Francesca is an amazing professor. Her quick wit and genuine care for the subject matter inspired me to become a sociology major. She is thus far the best professor I have had in the Sociology department. Her reading assignments are also interesting and informative. Make sure to read all assigned readings if you hope to receive an A in the course.

She's pretty rad, controversial, and has lots of good advice. She doesn't give quizzes and is honest about her opinion of the course material. She does get into arguments with students sometimes, often when she misunderstands what they say. But it always makes class interesting...
Fran is the craziest teacher i've had in years...  she will babble on for hours about her own stupid life, and threatens to fail everyone if they do one thing wrong.  fran sucks, i learned nothing..

Fran definitely scares many students with her sarcasm and harsh wit but I thought she was hilarious. As long as you are honestly trying in the class and don't ignore her directions she is super helpful and friendly. Going to class = extra points, enough of them to be worth waking up hella early.
Professor Guerra is a so humorous you enjoy going to class. She makes everything so interesting . I actually never missed class just because i liked going. Let me warn you. Lots of books.
Fun and easy class but she was very proud of her self but it wasn't horrible.

Fran is a little intimidating at first but extremely funny and knowledgeable. I learned more in her class than any other I've taken at this school. Even though there was a good amount of work, I really enjoyed going to her class and learning about the material.

Fran is great...she is really crazy and could possibly offend people, but she is hilarious and  loves her subject. She is however a bit full of herself and can get really off topic, but it is usually relevant. Overall it is an easy and fun class and a good intro to the field of sociology.

Fran is my favorite professor. I've had her for issues, intro to soc, soc psych, community & mass media, and I have her in 103B currently. She is amazing in all of these,  My fav was 116 it was at 8 am but she still made it so interesting, that you don't want to miss class. She seems crazy the first day but dont let her scare you, she is amazing :)

Fran is so awesome she gave me a D and I'm still giving her a good review. I had her also for SOCY10 and SOCY1. Fran does an amazing job of explaining things in class. The reason I got a bad grade in 116 was because it was 8am and I kept sleeping through class, and I got lost. The readings are pretty difficult if you haven't taken theory.

The book is super helpful since the teacher gets off track oh too often. Read the book and you'll pass the class. Lectures consist of some step by step processes, but a lot of bragging about her intelligence and what not. She cracks some jokes once in a while, but misses to teach the subject at hand.

I love Fran she is awesome. The only people who may not like her are the ones who are doing bad because they never show up to class or do their work. Step your game up students.  She is super smart and I will be definitely taking her again!

Do not take her class if possible.. all she does is spend the entire class time bragging about herself. Its cool that she has a million degrees but they're pretty useless on account of she can't actually teach anything.. But she is a very relaxed grader and doesn't assign much homework, so that was nice I guess.
Took this class in the summer. Fairly easy class if you understand and love statistics. Goes off on tangents, so good luck studying from the book yourself!

Fran can get off topic easily, but overall she's very helpful. She writes A LOT of comments on your papers, and is very critical of them. I got relatively high scores on her papers because of the help she gave me. She is definitely not one of those peofessors who just gives you a grade on a paper without telling you why.
Best class I have ever taken! Fran is awesome!  She may go off topic now and then, but it all relates to the course.
It was a fun learning experience! Fran is extremely knowledgeable, and you will never get bored in class because the lectures are so great! I highly recommend you to take this class.

Doesn't really lecture, just rants. Be prepared to take notes down when she rants bc everything she says is important. I recc a laptop for notes bc she talks so fast. 2 midterms no final so you basically finish early. Short answer tests. Study the study guide. She's very blunt and kinda crazy. She expects you to read so be prepared.

Professor Guerra is inspiring. I don't know why some of the comments on here are so negative. Your grade consists of 3 things: 25% for attending section, 35% for first midterm & 40% for the final. Both the midterm and final are the same structure, all short answers. She gives out a study guide with ALL the info on it before tests. She's very clear.

She does not lecture. She rants. She is extremely vague and assignments are confusing. She acknowledges every single time a student leaves early or is whispering, which is just ten times more distracting. However, this course is mandatory to the major and I would still recommend that you take it with her, just make sure you get a good TA.

Professor Guerra's teaching style is not conducive to learning. She is extremely disorganized and her grading is not representative of much. She refuses to adapt her teaching style to the needs of her students and instead, brags about her teaching awards. I'm a double major and I'm struggling to get a B in this GE course. Don't take this class.

Her readings/ paper feedback is helpful. Her lectures were totally disorganized and ranty. I didn't learn anything from her lectures. Her reading selections were great. Fran is incredibly unprofessional and I wonder if she is mentally unstable. She screamed at me and called me an idiot seemingly out of nowhere during a meeting. Very painful for me.

I got a C/D on ALL my papers, then ended up getting an A in the class. She actually reads EVERYTHING in your papers and gives you TONS of feedback (some kind of insulting).  But just take her critisism constructively and suck it up, and you will surely get a decent grade and learn a little something about the subject and your writing skills :)

not clear about expectations! then has high/very particular expectations? so frustrating. She is very intelligent and knows her FACTS, she will fact correct you on your papers, so make sure papers are accurate.lectures are interesting but has nothing to do with material, well kindov.class is frustrating but if u try you can get a C/B

Fran knows her stuff, but lectures are pointless and make absolutely zero sense - no organization. Unfortunately she is extremely opinionated and if you don't share her FAR leftist views, she isn't going to like you and it WILL affect your grade. Essay prompts are ridiculously vague, and then her comments are mean and attacking. AVOID if you can.
Great lecturer, hard grader, can be intimidating but is nice and helpful if you go to her office hours. You will pass the class if you try
Wastes 1hr 45min talking about herself.

I often have a hard time paying attention during hour and 45 minute classes, but never with prof. Guerra. Yes, sometimes she trails off on tangents but they're never boring stories and she often has a great sense of humor while telling them. She is passionate about human rights and fighting the current system. I really enjoy attending her class

Fran is one of the most amazing instructors we have on campus. Those of you who complain about her are lazy and spoiled brats.The same people who don't have the slightest passion for saving humanity. Unplug your laptop/facebook/youtube for 2 hour and absorb the knowledge, because you need it! All you have to do are the readings + attend class =  A

Besides Nasser, Guerra is one of the worst professors ever. She's very unprofessional, lectures are disorganized, she spends them telling pointless stories about herself, exams (both free response part and take-home essay part) are really difficult/inconsistent. She crankily yells at students if they leave class early. I barely passed her class.

Fran is the best professor-bar none. She has geniune care for her students, and she cares about what she preaches. She is inspiring, atriculate, and extremely knowledgeable. She will open your eyes to a whole different world, if you let her. Her New York attitude might not be for everyone.
midterms are easy, just skim the notes and you'll do fine. fran is very entertaining!

Fran is a little too much. She is very intolerant with contray opinions.  Frankly, she is irritating.  The class is almost too easy.  Nevertheless, the material is very interesting and she is a fun lecturer.

I'll admit, I was afraid of Fran when I first met  her.  But you really have to go in and talk to her.  She WANTS to get to know you.  Her class seemed daunting at first, but it is completely doable, and extremely informative and interesting at that.  The class is a little depressing, but cmon, the TITLE of the class is depressing!

She's cool but she's opinionated. If you don't share the same opinions she can be intolerant of you. Otherwise I think students can pass her class with their eyes closed. Too easy. Interesting but seriously easy.

This was the 3rd class I took with Fran, and I think the last. Her classes are an easy A and her lectures are interesting, but unless you are left, left, left on the political spectrum, she will HATE you, so don't speak up in class. It got to the point that I didn't believe anything she was saying anymore because she is so biased.
She is amazing. Hands down, the best professor. Engaging, helpful, extremely smart. UCSC should hire her full time dammit! Students sign up for her waiting list months and months ahead of time.
She is the professor that you remember for the rest of your life. If you get her, you're one lucky SOB

Fran is an amazing instructor and my only regret was not meeting her until my senior year.  I hope that students get to take her classes at LEAST once throughout their college education if not more, because she is by far one of the best instructors I've ever had in my 16 years of schooling.  She makes going to class fun, I never missed single day.  She is genuine and wants you to learn; she is incredibly helpful and encouraging.  Take a class taught by her, you won't regret it!

Fran was one of the best teachers I have ever had.  She cares deeply about the topics that she teaches, which shows in how she relates the material to everyday life.  Her rants are hilarious, uh huh, uh huh!  She will make you think twice about everything

Fran is excellent!  She loves what she does and is proud of it.  Her work is incredibly interesting and I love when she took time to tell us about it.  She's very New York and that made her classes insanely funny to me, but some found it a little abrasive.
She's such a fantastic teacher!!
She is strict but if you like a Military style of teaching and thats the only way you will get your work done then go for this woman.

taken all of her classes, shes soooo smart and knows her stuff, and is totally helpful and always there for her students and loves giving feedback and working with them, her classes are challenging but completely worth it.
No Comments
No Comments
NOT a good teacher.  If she hates Santa Cruz so much, why is she teaching here?  That puzzles me.  Her tests were ridiculous.  DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS
Fran was by far the most inspiring interesting professor I have ever had. Regardless of your major. You'r time at UCSC will not be complete without taking a class with Fran- NO KIDDING.

I am a psych and lgst major and this class was the best fit for both. Some of the topics overlapped the ones introduced in psych and law 146 taught by Haney, some elaborated more, and most of the info was totally new (and interesting).  I was not confused and I didnt even read the books since Fran went over readings in lecture. perfect class.

Fran knows what she is talking about, but the problem is that most law students have no idea. The sociology students get her, but the class is based off 90% soc and only 10% law. Take her if you are soc, but not law.

Fran's NY humor may not be appealing to the sensitive, but she is the best teacher I've had in my 16 years of schooling.  Very opinionated but not misguided, having evidence/reason as backup. Very personable and genuinely cares/empathizes w/students. Very passionate about the topic. Hands out extensions and emails lecture notes to those who ask.

Fran is extremely intelligent and funny. She makes class interesting and lively every day. People who cannot handle her excitement or humor should not take her classes. I would argue, however, that attending this university for 4 years without taking a class with Fran would be a mistake.
Fran is to intense and self absorbed.  She is passionate about research but not her students.
She talks too fast and sounds squeeky

Fran inspires and motivates students. She is very helpful and a great resource. She is very passionate about her work.Just the way she presents the material made me go to ALL of her classes, it was an awesome class, and the best course I've ever taken here at UCSC.

Fran is great. She's the most helpful and available professor I've had. She's very passionate about her work and there's never a doubt as to what is expected from you. Her lectures are interesting and provide useful information. She also assigns  relevant readings that arent terribly boring.
She was an excellent TA. She was very helpful and always available.
Fran is a very...excitable teacher.  She's excited about everything she teaches and passes on that enthusiasm and excitement to her students.  I'd take another class of hers without hesitation.
She is completely insane but great at teaching the material.
She is extremely cocky and disagreeable...i really did not like her

Fran's great although her style may turn some off. She's very brash, opinionated but really smart. Somehow she makes her lectures interesting and provides clear, concise notes. She'll never present something that won't be of use to you for tests/papers.

She's extremely knowledgeable of what she is teaching and has many experiences of which she applies to her lectures. It was practically like story time, but each story had an underlying message to take away. She tells it like it is. although she is bias, she has her own opinion, and i think that's what makes this class so real and interesting.

fran rambles on and on about things that she thinks connects and relates to the class, yet they often times dont. she cracks jokes more than she teaches. she doesnt allow laptops in class, which for me, made note taking a little difficult. overall shes not a great professor but would probably make a good comedian.

She's one of the worst professors I have had. She doesn't teach, she tells pointless stories for 2 hours and then yells at people for leaving 5 mins early. She makes her tests purposefully vague, and uses a grading system that makes it difficult to do better than a B because the point totals are so low if you miss 2 or 3 points it drops the grade.

I can't say enough about Fran. It may sound corny, but this is the 1st class I've taken at UCSC that's really made me question the world around me, and think about it critically - and isn't that what school is all about? Yes, she's opinionated, yes, she can go on tangents, but she always makes her point. Take her classes.

Fran is great! Her lectures are incredibly engaging and entertaining and she really cares that her students learn. I learned a lot about serious issues that go on in the world that I, like most people I've discussed this with, have never heard about. This class teaches you important things and Fran is a fun teacher

The overall complaint I have is that the class is very unorganized. She really makes an effort to connect class concepts to current events, but sometimes it goes over the top, and she ends up ranting about world issues (and personal issues), while ignoring class material. Sometime I feel as if it's a stand-up comedy performance, not a class.

I have a love/dislike relationship w/ her teaching. She goes off in tangents, gets mad& calls you out if u leave lecture but as hard as she sounds, she really wants every1 to succeed & do well. She makes class real easy and I should have gotten an A if a tried harder & was better w/ #'s. My 2nd class w/ her& she's funny& irratating at the same time

Fran is really helpful and wants her students to succeed. She admits that she is not a statistics teacher, and it showed in class. The subject is insufferable but Fran really tried to level with her students through extra points and helpful notes.

Fran is kind of all over the place when it comes to her teaching methods, but as long as you show up to class and take notes on WHAT SHE SAYS there's nothing preventing you from acing this class. She includes examples she gives in class on the exams. Section is mandatory. Only used texts for section and exams.

I don't think Guerra's liberal views would hurt your grade at all. The class is an easy B without ever having to read the books, but I got an A for not BS-ing and actually applying reading terms and lecture ideas to the midterms.

Very knowledgeable, clearly very intelligent, and an overall fantastic professor! Great intro class. (In response to the 9/20/2010 comment, I believe she went to UCSB for undergrad and Yale for graduate work and possibly her doctorate. This is what she's said in class; I've never heard her claim to have gone to Yale for undergrad.)

Fran is "The Truth!" She tells it how it is and doesn't sugar-coat anything!!! Her lectures are interesting and entertaining...this is a class you will definitely never fall asleep in! The concepts are easy to grasp and she is a very understanding individual.

very nice, funny, but has a tendency to go off on long tangents that don't always have much to do with what we're learning, then claim it's totally useful but not test on it. also maybe its me but i can't always find the answers to the study guide in my notes, even though i write down EVERYTHING.

Fran is really condescending and not at all a good teacher. I don't know why so many people are crazy and like her, but she is NOT what I want to be paying 3,000 a quarter for. Really shows what a joke education is sometimes.

Fran is totally crazy, but in the best way.  She's incredibly intelligent, and always provides a ton of examples to make the abstract concepts more clear.  I loved her class, and plan on taking several more with her.
So did she actually go to Yale for her undergrad? On her dissertation published in 2000 it says she got her BA from UCSB. Interesting.

Fran is an interesting professor -- she tells a lot of stories and is pretty funny. She's very opinionated, and you might not always agree. Her class is very easy -- she gives a complete review before tests, and most of the grade comes from meeting the requirements that she mentions. Not hard to do well if you pay attention.

Not a difficult class to get an A in. Grade consists of 2 tests, 1 paper and section. Fran goes over everything that will be on the test on a review sheet. She seems like a good person, but very depressed. Very bitter. HATED her at first (due to constant RANTS) but she grew on me a little. I just wish she was happier. I think she deserves it.

If you are lazy, disinterested or apathetic, you will not enjoy her class. If you are studious and have a thirst for knowledge, then take her classes. She can come off strong I know,  but she TRUELY wants her students to succeed and she WILL help you if you ask for it. if you put in the time and effort you will succeed.

This teacher is an experience. She was okay the first time I took her but after the second time she became boring and redundant. She is well educated(she talks about it almost every class) but her assumption that everyone else knows what she is talking about is confusing. Sarcastic and opinionated, save yourself the trouble, go w/ someone else
